text: 14.73 Part 1(p) seeks to ensure that artificial lighting is well-designed and uses appropriate light levels. For the purpose of this policy, light pollution is defined as the adverse effect of artificial lighting and includes glare, light spillage and sky glow. Odour and fumes from commercial developments can also have an adverse impact on the amenity of surrounding residents.
